poem:
### Placeholder Planet

In the draft, a hollow [X],  
trillion dreams suspended mid-air,  
as islands fray at the edges  
and jungle lungs inhale despair.  
Countless zeroes, a phantom sum  
to ransom the earth from burning coals;  
slate grey skies hold their breath—  
can we ink a future into these scrolls?
